bcl:section.bcl:text: On pound breach or rescue of personal property distrained for rent, the person aggrieved is entitled to recover triple damages and costs of action against the offender, or against the owner of the property distrained, if the property later comes into his or her possession.

change.changenote: Section 10 BEFORE amended by 2023-10-994, effective March 30, 2023 (Royal Assent).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Double damage and costs against wrongful distress
bcl:section.bcl:text: If distress and sale is made for rent alleged to be due, and no rent is due to the person distraining, or to the person in whose name or right the distress is taken, then the owner of the property distrained and sold, or his or her personal representatives, may, by proceeding against the person distraining, or the personal representatives, recover double the value of the property distrained and sold, together with full costs of the proceedings.

change.changenote: Section 11 BEFORE amended by 2023-10-995, effective March 30, 2023 (Royal Assent).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Landlord may distrain and sell property fraudulently carried off the premises
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a tenant or lessee of land, the rent of which is due, fraudulently or clandestinely takes from the premises his or her personal property, to prevent the landlord or lessor from distraining it for arrears of rent, the landlord or lessor, or any person lawfully empowered by the landlord or lessor for that purpose, within 30 days after the taking of the property, may seize that property, wherever found, as distress for the arrears of rent, and dispose of the property as if the property had been distrained by the lessor or landlord on the premises for the arrears of rent.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Distress not unlawful because of subsequent irregularity
bcl:section.bcl:text: If distress is made for rent or taxes due or for a penalty legally imposed, and any irregularity or unlawful act is afterwards done by the party distraining, or by his or her agent, the distress is not unlawful, nor is the party making it a trespasser, but the party aggrieved by the unlawful act or irregularity may recover in any court of competent jurisdiction satisfaction for the special damage he or she sustains, together with his or her costs of suit.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Persons levying distress to give copy of charges to party distrained
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who makes and levies distress must give a copy of the demand, and of all the costs and charges of the distress, signed by him or her, to the person on whose property the distress is levied.
